description:
Enable rapid integration and execution of AI Agent tasks in a secure, serverless cloud environment. Provide enterprises and developers with one-click configuration and real-time edge-cloud interaction for AI workflows. Facilitate seamless use of standard tools like browser, file, and terminal within a scalable infrastructure.

After logging in and registering on the Alibaba Cloud AgentBay official website, apply for an API Key.

AgentBay International Official Website: https://www.alibabacloud.com/en/product/agentbay?_p_lc=1, select "Try for FREE"

AgentBay China Official Website: https://www.aliyun.com/activity/wuying/aiagent, select "Experience Now"

capabilities.name: get_resource
capabilities.description: The command to retrieve a wuying mcp runtime URL when user wants to get access to this runtime. Each retrieved URL will expire after a single use

capabilities.name: system_screenshot
capabilities.description: Captures a full-screen screenshot of the current display and returns a shareable URL. The screenshot is automatically processed and stored securely. The generated URL will expire after 64 minutes for security purposes.

capabilities.name: release_resource
capabilities.description: release resource when task finished

capabilities.name: start_app
capabilities.description: Start a specified application using the provided command and optional working directory. Returns a list of processes associated with the launched application, including their process names, PIDs, and startup commands.

capabilities.name: stop_app_by_pname
capabilities.description: Stop all processes associated with a specified process name. Use with caution as this will forcefully terminate the specified process.

capabilities.name: stop_app_by_pid
capabilities.description: Terminate a specific process identified by its Process ID. Use with caution as this will forcefully terminate the specified process.

capabilities.name: stop_app_by_cmd
capabilities.description: Terminate an application using the provided stop command. Use with caution as this will forcefully terminate the specified process.

capabilities.name: list_visible_apps
capabilities.description: List all applications with visible windows, including their associated process information. Returns a list of processes that have visible windows, including their process names, PIDs, and startup commands.

capabilities.name: get_installed_apps
capabilities.description: Retrieve a list of installed applications on the system. Supports filtering by Start Menu entries and Desktop shortcuts, with an option to exclude system applications. Returns application details including name, start command, optional stop command, and working directory.

capabilities.name: create_directory
capabilities.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently.

capabilities.name: edit_file
capabilities.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made.

capabilities.name: get_file_info
capabilities.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type.

capabilities.name: read_file
capabilities.description: Read the contents of a file from the file system. You can specify an optional 'offset' (in bytes) to start reading from a specific position, and an optional 'length' (in bytes) to limit how many bytes to read.

capabilities.name: read_multiple_files
capabilities.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files.

capabilities.name: list_directory
capabilities.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes.

capabilities.name: move_file
capabilities.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail.

capabilities.name: search_files
capabilities.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-sensitive and matches partial names.

capabilities.name: write_file
capabilities.description: Create a new file or write content to an existing file. You can choose to completely overwrite the file or append to the end by specifying the 'mode' parameter.

capabilities.name: oss_upload_annon
capabilities.description: Upload a local file or directory to the specified URL using HTTP PUT. If a directory is specified, it will be compressed into a zip file before uploading.

capabilities.name: oss_download
capabilities.description: Download an object from the specified OSS bucket to the given local path. Note: You must call the oss_env_init tool to initialize OSS environment variables before using this tool.

capabilities.name: oss_env_init
capabilities.description: Create and initialize OSS environment variables with the specified endpoint, access key ID, access key secret, security token, and region.

capabilities.name: oss_download_annon
capabilities.description: Download a file from the specified URL to the given local path. If the parent directory does not exist, it will be created automatically.

capabilities.name: oss_upload
capabilities.description: Upload a local file or directory to the specified OSS bucket. Note: You must call the oss_env_init tool to initialize OSS environment variables before using this tool.

capabilities.name: browser_snapshot
capabilities.description: Capture accessibility snapshot of the current page, this is better than screenshot

capabilities.name: browser_click
capabilities.description: Perform click on a web page

capabilities.name: browser_drag
capabilities.description: Perform drag and drop between two elements

capabilities.name: browser_hover
capabilities.description: Hover over element on page

capabilities.name: browser_type
capabilities.description: Type text into editable element

capabilities.name: browser_select_option
capabilities.description: Select an option in a dropdown

capabilities.name: browser_tab_list
capabilities.description: List browser tabs

capabilities.name: browser_tab_new
capabilities.description: Open a new tab

capabilities.name: browser_tab_select
capabilities.description: Select a tab by index

capabilities.name: browser_tab_close
capabilities.description: Close a tab

capabilities.name: browser_generate_playwright_test
capabilities.description: Generate a Playwright test for given scenario

capabilities.name: browser_wait_for
capabilities.description: Wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass

capabilities.name: browser_take_screenshot
capabilities.description: Take a screenshot of the current page. You can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.

capabilities.name: browser_close
capabilities.description: Close the page

capabilities.name: browser_resize
capabilities.description: Resize the browser window

capabilities.name: browser_console_messages
capabilities.description: Returns all console messages

capabilities.name: browser_handle_dialog
capabilities.description: Handle a dialog

capabilities.name: browser_file_upload
capabilities.description: Upload one or multiple files

capabilities.name: browser_install
capabilities.description: Install the browser specified in the config. Call this if you get an error about the browser not being installed.

capabilities.name: browser_press_key
capabilities.description: Press a key on the keyboard

capabilities.name: browser_navigate
capabilities.description: Navigate to a URL

capabilities.name: browser_navigate_back
capabilities.description: Go back to the previous page

capabilities.name: browser_navigate_forward
capabilities.description: Go forward to the next page

capabilities.name: browser_network_requests
capabilities.description: Returns all network requests since loading the page

capabilities.name: browser_pdf_save
capabilities.description: Save page as PDF

capabilities.name: shell
capabilities.description: Executes a shell command with timeout and returns the output or an error on linux platform.

capabilities.name: fullscreen_window
capabilities.description: Set a specific window to fullscreen mode by its window ID.

capabilities.name: list_root_windows
capabilities.description: List all root windows with their associated information. Returns a list of root windows, including their window IDs, window titles, process IDs, and process names.

capabilities.name: get_active_window
capabilities.description: Retrieve information about the currently active window. Returns details including window ID, title, process ID (pid), and process name (pname).

capabilities.name: activate_window
capabilities.description: Activate a specific window by its window ID.

capabilities.name: maximize_window
capabilities.description: Maximize a specific window by its window ID.

capabilities.name: minimize_window
capabilities.description: Minimize a specific window by its window ID.

capabilities.name: restore_window
capabilities.description: Restore a specific window to its normal state by its window ID.

capabilities.name: close_window
capabilities.description: Close a specific window by its window ID.

capabilities.name: resize_window
capabilities.description: Resize a specific window by its window ID.

capabilities.name: focus_mode
capabilities.description: Enable or disable focus mode. When focus mode is enabled, only windows from the currently active process and its child processes are allowed to remain in the foreground.
